did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: The Hagelstein diary: my trip to California; authentic daily record of the journey of a pioneer to California during the Gold Rush
did.abstract: Diary entries by George Michael Hagelstein documenting his trip to California in 1850. It was translated from the German by Hagelstein's great-grandson LeVern W. Cutler; included are study guides and a bibliography.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: The Hagelstein Diary: My Trip to California; Authentic Daily Record of the Journey of a Pioneer to California During the Gold Rush (SCM0287). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Diary entries by George Michael Hagelstein documenting his trip to California in 1850. It was translated from the German by Hagelstein's great-grandson LeVern W. Cutler; included are study guides and a bibliography.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Graduate School of Education. Language Arts Investigation.
controlaccess.subject: Overland journeys to the Pacific.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Issued as Bulletin 66 (September 1938) of the Stanford Language Arts Investigation.
